questions.question: What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array by index?
questions.explanation: Array elements are stored in contiguous memory locations, allowing O(1) access time by index.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of finding the middle element in a singly linked list in a single pass?
questions.explanation: Using the fast and slow pointer technique, we can find the middle in O(n) time with a single pass.

questions.question: Which of the following is a mutable data type in Python?
questions.explanation: Lists are mutable in Python, meaning their elements can be changed after creation.
This will throw a ReferenceError due to the temporal dead zone (TDZ) of the inner x variable.

questions.question: What is the correct way to perform side effects in function components?
questions.explanation: The useEffect hook is used to perform side effects in function components, replacing lifecycle methods like componentDidMount and componentDidUpdate.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid way to create a thread in Java?
questions.explanation: Extending Object class doesn't provide any threading capabilities. The standard ways are extending Thread, implementing Runnable, or using ExecutorService.

questions.question: What is the typical voltage level for GPIO pins on a Raspberry Pi?
questions.explanation: Most GPIO pins on a Raspberry Pi operate at 3.3V logic levels, though some power pins provide 5V.

questions.question: Which type of join returns all records when there is a match in either left or right table?
questions.explanation: FULL OUTER JOIN returns all records when there is a match in either the left or right table records.

questions.question: Which index type in MongoDB supports efficient queries on geospatial data?
questions.explanation: MongoDB provides geospatial indexes that support queries of location-based data using the 2dsphere index type.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to align flex items along the main axis?
questions.explanation: The justify-content property aligns flex items along the main axis of the flex container.

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms has the best average-case time complexity for comparison-based sorting?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort has a consistent O(n log n) time complexity in all cases, while Quick Sort has O(n log n) average case but can degrade to O(n²) in the worst case.
